question: It's 8am. A brand new day with many things to do for this busy potato. Would you:
choice1: Violently shake the potato awake. He was supposed to wake up an hour ago!
choice2: Let the poor potato rest for another 15 minutes.
choice3: Gently wake the lil guy so he can get started on all his activities.
choice4: Lightly prodding the potato is warranted, but allow it an additional brief repose should the need arise.

question: The potato wakes up from his deep slumber. What will his first actions of the day be:
choice1: Sigh and sob about the sorrows of the world.
choice2: Pick up the soft toys that have been cruelly kicked off the bed by the sleeping potato.
choice3: Scroll social media and see what fellow potatoes are complaining about in their lives.
choice4: Pick up the phone and text all his spud buds about his upcoming day.

question: A long list of tasks awaits the potato. How will he handle them all:
choice1: Crumble under the pressure of everything.
choice2: Try to find his lost pen to get started on the tasks.
choice3: Come up with a star strategy to solve all the problems that need to be solved quickly.
choice4: Succumb to the sudden urge to take a walk around the house before getting started on his tasks.

question: Ding! A close spud bud rants in their group chat about some problems they are facing. The potato has the following reaction:
choice1: Manages to calm and comfort his buddy easily.
choice2: Immediately understands the issue that his buddy is facing and offers possible solutions.
choice3: Remains unbothered by the little ranting going on.
choice4: Feels bad about his buddy going through his troubles and sends emotional support stickers in the chat.

question: It's finally lunch time. The potato goes out to get his lunch. His typical lunch run includes:
choice1: Talking to the neighbours and store owners he meets along the way.
choice2: Skipping along the streets and humming his favorite tunes.
choice3: Trying out a new food chain with a menu he doesn't understand.
choice4: Spending 5 minutes trying to find his house keys before going out for lunch.

question: The potato is back to work and faces a challenge in his big boy corporate job. He tackles this difficulty by:
choice1: Spending a large amount of time trying to understand the challenge fully and properly.
choice2: Letting his creative juices flow to come up with a unique solution for the problem.
choice3: Raging at the silly spud that caused this challenge for him to solve.
choice4: Talking to a bunch of different spuds to investigate and solve the issue.

question: Eventually, the potato manages to overcome the problem and receives praise and recognition for it. He feels strongly:
choice1: Happy to be recognised as the key problem-solver.
choice2: Relieved that the spud that caused the problem will no longer have to live in guilt.
choice3: Distracted as he searches for his phone to reply to the kind messages.
choice4: Stressed because it takes him a while to calm down after a tough situation.

question: In the evening, the potato goes out for a little spuds gathering to unwind after a long day. The gathering proceeds with:
choice1: The potato sharing about his tough day and crisis averted.
choice2: The potato listening to the other spuds share interesting details about their day.
choice3: The potato missing a good part of the conversations because he arrived late.
choice4: The potato feeling cheery as always about spending time with the spuds and having an overall good day.

question: At the end of the long day, the potato finishes it off with:
choice1: Quiet alone time to sit with his lil thoughts.
choice2: Reflecting on the spuds he managed to helped and the strong bonds he has forged that day.
choice3: Looking through the pretty pictures that he has taken throghout his day.
choice4: Remembering funny conversations and delicious lunch he got to enjoy that day.

question: The potato stares at the motivational poster on his ceiling and gradually falls back into his deep slumber. The poster reads:
choice1: Take deep breaths, everything will be okay.
choice2: Slow and steady, hard work pays off.
choice4: Nothing, just a picture of 3 sheep jumping over a fence
